page.title: 14BIDBOROUGH VILLAGE HALL
page.content: Bidborough Village Hall was built in 1973. The money needed was raised by the local people who stage open days in the village when each club and society makes its contribution to the festivities and several gardens are opened to the public. In one month during the summer of 1985 14 organisations used the excellent facilities of the hall, in addition to the regular use by the church and school. Meetings are organised by the Women's Institute, the Wives' Club, the Photographic Society and the Gardening and Drama Clubs. Classes are held for Keep Fit, Art and Dressmaking. The Welfare Baby Clinic and the weekly library use the Hall. The Badminton, Cricket, Bowls and Tennis clubs also used the Hall during the month.
